perturbation.original_text:
8.1.1 Operator, with respect to Operator's activities provided for under this Agreement, shall maintain the following insurance coverage with responsible insurance carriers and/or through a program of self-insurance:
(a) Workers' Compensation. Operator shall maintain statutory worker's compensation insurance, covering all of its and its Affiliates' employees and statutory employees, in accordance with the benefits afforded by the statutory Worker's Compensation Acts applicable to the state, territory, or district of hire, supervision, or place of accident. In addition, Operator shall maintain employer's liability insurance with a limit of not less than one million dollars ($1,000,000) each accident, one million dollars ($1,000,000) disease each employee, and one million dollars ($1,000,000) disease policy limit. Where not prohibited by law, Operator shall waive its right of subrogation against Owner.
(b) Commercial General Liability Insurance. Operator shall maintain Commercial General Liability Insurance covering its operations under this Agreement including, without limitation, bodily injury, death, property damage, independent contractors, products/completed operations, contractual, and personal injury liability, with a limit of not less than one million dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence and two million dollars ($2,000,000) in the annual aggregate.
(c) Commercial Automobile Insurance. Operator shall maintain Commercial Automobile Insurance coverage, including, without limitation, bodily injury and property damage for owned, hired, rented, and non-owned automotive equipment with a limit of not less than one million dollars ($1,000,000) per accident.
(d) Umbrella Liability Insurance. Operator shall maintain Umbrella Liability Insurance coverage covering in excess of (a), (b), and (c) above, excluding Worker's Compensation, in the amount of ten million dollars ($10,000,000).
perturbation.changed_text:
8.1.1 Operator, with respect to Operator's activities provided for under this Agreement, shall maintain the following insurance coverage with responsible insurance carriers and/or through a program of self-insurance:
(a) Workers' Compensation. Operator shall maintain worker's compensation insurance. Where not prohibited by law, Operator shall waive its right of subrogation against Owner.
(b) Commercial General Liability Insurance. Operator shall maintain General Liability Insurance covering its operations under this Agreement.
(c) Commercial Automobile Insurance. Operator shall maintain Automobile Insurance coverage, including bodily injury and property damage for automotive equipment.
(d) Umbrella Liability Insurance. Operator shall maintain Umbrella Liability Insurance coverage.
perturbation.explanation: Removing specific coverage amounts and detailed descriptions weakens the insurance requirements, potentially violating state-mandated minimum coverage laws for businesses in Texas or Oklahoma. The removal of the coverage limits and specific types of coverage normally expected will leave the owner at risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by state (Texas or Oklahoma) but typically involves minimum insurance coverage requirements for commercial operations and employer's liability.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1.2 To the extent of the liabilities assumed by Operator in this Agreement, Operator shall name Owner Indemnified Parties as additional insured on all insurance policies, except Workers' Compensation. The Owner Indemnified Parties' additional insured status will not limit the application of insurance protection as required by this Agreement which arises out of the Operator's indemnity obligations. These policies shall provide primary coverage for claims in which Operator has agreed to hold harmless and/or to indemnify the Owner Indemnified Parties. No "other insurance" clause may be invoked by any insurer. This coverage shall apply whether or not the indemnification is valid. Operator shall have its insurer(s) waive its right of subrogation against Owner Indemnified Parties on all insurance carried. Unless expressly stated to the contrary elsewhere in this Agreement or prohibited by applicable law or legal statute, Operator's indemnification obligations under this Agreement shall not be limited by amount or in scope to coverage provided by insurance which is required under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1.2 To the extent of the liabilities assumed by Operator in this Agreement, Operator may name Owner Indemnified Parties as additional insured on insurance policies, except Workers' Compensation. The Owner Indemnified Parties' additional insured status may limit the application of insurance protection as required by this Agreement. These policies may provide coverage for claims. An "other insurance" clause may be invoked by any insurer. This coverage may apply whether or not the indemnification is valid. Operator may have its insurer(s) waive its right of subrogation against Owner Indemnified Parties on all insurance carried. Operator's indemnification obligations under this Agreement shall be limited by amount or in scope to coverage provided by insurance which is required under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall' to 'may' and adding language that limits the scope of coverage dramatically weakens the protection for the Owner. By limiting Owner's protection, this introduces a contradiction to the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing, and it might fail to meet basic requirements for reasonable risk transfer via insurance, potentially conflicting with state insurance regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing; potential violations of state insurance regulations regarding risk transfer.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1.3 Upon request, Operator agrees to furnish to Owner certificates of insurance or other evidence satisfactory to Owner to demonstrate that the required insurance has been procured and is in force. The certificate shall accurately reflect the required insurance coverages and shall provide that in the event of modification, expiration, cancellation or material change in a policy affecting the certificate holder, thirty days prior written notice shall be given to the certificate holder. Operator waives all rights against Owner for recovery of damages to the extent such damages are covered by the insurance maintained in accordance with this Section 8.1.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1.3 Operator may furnish to Owner certificates of insurance to demonstrate that insurance has been procured. Operator may waive all rights against Owner for recovery of damages covered by insurance maintained in accordance with this Section 8.1.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'agrees to furnish' to 'may furnish,' the agreement no longer guarantees that the Owner will receive proof of insurance. This removal undermines the Owner's ability to verify compliance with insurance requirements, which introduces legal risk under various state regulatory frameworks that require businesses to maintain and demonstrate proof of adequate insurance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by state (Texas or Oklahoma), but typically involves regulations requiring businesses to maintain and provide proof of insurance coverage.
